full_summary:
# Tender Notice: Wildlife and Flora Services

**Title**
Advance Contract Award Notice: Duck Banding Services at Lac Saint-Pierre

**Reference Number**
cb-803-11634791

**Publication Date**
June 6, 2024

**Tender Closing Date**
June 21, 2024, 3:00 PM

**Contracting Entity**
Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC)

**Contact Information**
Kassandra Lauzier
kassandra.lauzier@ec.gc.ca
(438) 801-0827

**Objective**
The Contracting Entity seeks the services of a Contractor to operate the duck banding station at Lac Saint-Pierre, Quebec, for the summer periods of 2024, 2025, and 2026. The Contractor will assist the Canadian Wildlife Service-Quebec (CWS-QC) in banding temperate geese on the Varennes Islands.

**Scope of Work**
The services required include:

* Operating the duck banding station at Lac Saint-Pierre, Anse-du-Fort sector
* Assisting CWS-QC in banding temperate geese on the Varennes Islands
* Participating in banding efforts for populations of these birds, if necessary
* Preparing for and conducting banding activities
* Capturing and banding ducks
* Daily data compilation and submission of a final report at the end of each summer season

**Deliverables**
The Contractor must submit a final report electronically to the Project Manager at the end of each summer season.

**Constraints**

* All work and deliverables must be in French.
* The Contractor will not be reimbursed for actual travel and living expenses reasonably incurred in the performance of the work.
* The Contractor must comply with the Waterfowl Banding Risk task risk analysis.

**Procurement** This Advance Contract Award Notice is a call for bids for the provision of duck banding services at Lac Saint-Pierre. Solicitations were made through the Canadabuys website on June 6, 2024. All interested parties are advised that the tender has expired.

**Attachments**
A detailed statement of work and tender documents are available for download from the Canadabuys website.

**UNSPSC Code**
70160000 Wildlife and flora

**Classification**
SRV — Services données Note to Tenderers
All tenderers are hereby notified that the tender has expired.
Government of Canada (GC) tendsers are subject to the procurement regulations of the GC
